intro: Monelasmum plicatum, commonly known as the pleated milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, pleated leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors or stream banks. Monelasmum plicatum is known for its milky sap, which is a characteristic feature of many plants in its family.
